Package gg.w6.chesslib.util

Class SanParser

java.lang.Object
gg.w6.chesslib.util.SanParser
public class SanParser extends Object
A utility class for parsing Standard Algebraic Notation (SAN) strings into Move objects.

This class supports castling, pawn moves (including captures and en passant), promotions, and disambiguated piece moves. It assumes all input SAN strings are legal and that the associated Position accurately reflects the game state.

This parser does not validate legality beyond what is required for unambiguous interpretation. Illegal SAN inputs will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

This class is not instantiable.

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public static Move parse(String san, Position position)
      Parses a legal SAN (Standard Algebraic Notation) string into a Move based on the given Position.

      Supports:

      • Short and long castling (O-O and O-O-O)
      • Pawn moves, captures, and promotions (e.g., e4, exd5, e8=Q)
      • Piece moves with optional disambiguation (e.g., Nf3, R1d1)

      The input need not contain check/mate suffixes (+, #); they are stripped automatically.

      Parameters:
      san - the SAN string representing a move
      position - the current Position the move applies to
      Returns:
      the parsed Move
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the SAN is unrecognized or ambiguous
